Reviews.Content: An adequate hotel at a reasonable price The hotel generally is lovely. The resort of Santa Susanna is small and quiet (especially in low season as we were there in November). The rooms are not the biggest I've stayed in, but are clean and well furnished. The food was good at breakfast and dinner, and the drink was reasonably priced. My one complaint is that the hotel charges for absiolutley EVERYTHING! I've never stayed in a hotel before that charges residents to use their pool (6 euro per head per day). Towels are 1.20 euro (not a deposit to ensure you return it, but a charge). And they really put the arm in if you need a late check-out! I could go on. We had paid extra for a superior room which we did not get. I've got my travel agent sorting out a refund now. These few issues really coloured my overall impression of the hotel. However the lobby is spacious and very clean, generally the staff are friendly and helpful, and the surrounding area is very pleasant.
Reviews.Author: nrc75

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel Just returned from a 6 night stay with our two children aged 8 and 11. This was a lovely hotel, very clean with efficient staff. We stayed half board and found the buffets in the morning and for the evening meal excellent. Don't usually like buffets as the food isn't always kept warm, but we never had a problem here, with a lot of the food cooked to order. We caught the train into Barcelona from outside the hotel, which cost about 拢20 for the 4 of us and had a great day. We will quite probably return to this hotel again as we loved the area and couldn't fault the hotel at all.
Reviews.Author: CityfanEastSussex

Reviews.Content: Good hotel Returned today from this hotel. We chose Santa Susana having stayed in Lloret de Mar earlier in the year. We liked the area, but were keen to avoid the Htop hotels as we stayed in one in Lloret and it was terrible, no where near 4 star. This hotel, however, is worthy of the 4 star rating, how 2 hotels in the same area can get the same rating was beyond us. The hotel has a smoking ban, which was great for us. Check in was swift and efficient and we went off to our room. This had 2 double beds and was of an average size. There was a full bathroom with shampoo, bath creme, soap, comb, shower cap and tissues. It was spotlessly clean. The room was cleaned daily and this was always to a high standard.We stayed full board. Breakfast was as expected, cereals, cold meats etc, fruit (this did not exist in our Htop earlier in the year be warned) full cooked, juice, tea coffee etc. Lunch was a buffet, as was dinner. The selection was varied from curry to roast, fish, various casserole type dishes. For starters there were soups and salads. Desserts saw a variety of cold choices, fruit, cakes and home baked biscuits. Drinks were extra. The service was efficient while we were there. The prices were 5.15 euros for 50cl house wine or 8.75 for a bottle of house wine. Water was 1.70 euros and coke 2 euros. The location of the hotel was good. It was right on the promenade and very close to the train station. There was a small indoor pool which we used, but in my opinion , at 6 euros was quite pricey for a small pool which was very crowded. there were several teenagers not behaving as they should have been which spoilt it for other users. Not the hotels fault, but parents who seemed absent from sight. We have teenagers so are not unrealistic. The hotel also charges 4 euros per day to use the car park. This is opposite the hotel and although it has a barrier I am not sure that is was any better patrolled than any other car park there! You could park in the adjacent area whcih we did, free.All in all we had a good break here. we would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to friends. we travel abroad about 4 times per year so are fairly experienced in the standard to expect from hotels. This one was as we expected.
Reviews.Author: Tessitura

Reviews.Content: Wonderful holiday We stayed here for our first family holiday with our 4 month old son and had a great time.The room we were given was a little smaller than we'd hoped (after reading other reviews) and a little cramped for a fortnight with a cot in it but it was nevertheless clean and comfortable with a nice balcony.As a buffet for a multinational guest list the restaurant was never going to be uniformly brilliant and there were evenings where the choice could be a little restrictive, particularly for those who don't eat pork or seafood. (That said, we would still recommend it to vegetarian friends.) Again, given the scale of the dining room, lukewarm food and empty platters were relatively rare. I'm not sure I'd have liked to be there during peak holiday periods though, as when it did get busier at the weekend things did slow down and we had finished our meal before we were given a chance to order drinks one night.The location was superb - the proximity to the train station made it ideal for getting further afield, whether in to Barcelona or just to/from neighbouring resorts. We would have liked to visit the little market outside in the evening for a stroll but baby's bedtime didn't permit. For practical shopping there is a very large supermarket only a 15 minute walk away or smaller ones along the promenade.The staff were friendly and helpful, the surroundings pleasant and the resort lovely. Unusually for us, there is a high chance of a return trip.
Reviews.Author: RMH1

Reviews.Content: brilliant hotel just returned from the Ona Brava food very good every day varied menu. staff friendly and helpful could not find fault in any wayhotel was kept spotlless to the point that there was even staff cleaning and dusting rhe indoor plants every morning.
Reviews.Author: ronbever

Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel Hotel was good value for money. The reception area is very nice with lots of marble and a piano Bar. Food was really good both for Breakfast and Evening meals. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. The only negative was the charge of 鈧? to use the indoor pool, but you do get access to the gym, sauna etc. The hotel is directly opposite Santa Susanna train station and makes Barcelona very accessible.
Reviews.Author: Blackpool-Tourer

Reviews.Content: loved the place !!!!! what can i say??? this hotel was beyond all our expecatations, one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in, went for one week with girlfriend and loved every minute of it.room on the 4th floor was huge and spotless with two double beds and great pool view balcony.had only booked bed and breakfast and the choice of food was huge, all the cold meats and cheese you could dream of and the hot food consisted of fried/scrambled eggs, pork sausages, bacon, black pudding (some days) with loads of fresh breads and a huge cake selection. room cleaned every daygreat hotel and great place to stay, superb
Reviews.Author: reilly1888

Reviews.Content: Not great My boyfriend and me had high hopes for this hotel which turned out to be a little disappointing. The room was not as spacious as we'd have liked, with one small double bed. We enquired about moving rooms, since we were also next to the lift, but were told we were lucky to have a 'pool view'. My other main criticism would be that the hotel has some good facilities, but all of them will cost you extra Euros which is not clear when you book! eg the table tennis, indoor pool, safe in room, the list goes on. Also beware there is no iron available for guests to borrow so we were forced to use their expensive in-house laundry service.Having said that, the rooms are clean and well maintained and the breakfast was a good spread.Hotel staff and locals in general appear to be sick to death of tourists so don't expect to be charmed. For a more realistic taste of Spain it's well worth getting the train to Barcelona, 1 hr away from the resort.
Reviews.Author: fashionfruit

Reviews.Content: Top spot to stay Short notice holidays are a risky enterprise and I've been bitten a couple of times in the past, but this hotel makes up for all my previous negative experiences. I cannot fault it, it would be nice to pick out one facet of the Hotel that outshines the rest but all areas seemed to gel to give you an excellent holiday experience.We visited at the end of the season chancing the weather flying from Newquay to Gerona, on arrival we were given a warm welcome and quickly checked in allowing us to get to the pool and enjoy the top entertainment team. Travelling with a young child can be fraught with problems but the team there bent over backwards to accomodate us.We stayed on a half board basis and the food was excellent, always a wide choice on the buffet, much cooked before you, table staff always smiling and helpful.We will definiately be revisiting this establishment.
Reviews.Author: Rovboy

Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, Few Issues though I want to start by saying that overall this hotel was really nice, but there were a few issues.When we arrived at the hotel we discovered that we were given a room on the 5th (top) floor, even though we requested in the order to have a room on the ground or first floor, as we had our 1 year old son with us. they stated that they had nothing available and would move us tomorrow. We accepted this and went to our room.On arrival at our room we were greated by a very bad damp smell, which we found out was being casued by the bathroom fan not working. As it was only for one night we opened the balcony doors to freshen up the room, we also put a card in the power unit so that the Air con stayed on perminantly even when we werent in the room.The balconies on the 5th floor which the hotel claim are child safe, are NOT child safe, the gap between the bar on the railings are big enough for our son to get through so make sure if you have children or a young age you do not let the hotel give you a room on the 5th floor.It took the hotel 2 days to move us to a room on a lower floor.The room we moved to was 100% better than the first room, it was bigger with two double beds, didnt smell as the fan in the bathroom was working and the balcony was a lot safer as it was half brick and half railings.We had no more complaints about our room for the whole holiday.The hotel itself was great the food was nice, and had a good selection. the staff were very friendly, and all spoke english as well as many other languages.The area is a purpose built area full of hotels and shops, the hotel is about a 5 min walk to thebeach and 10 mins to the man centre.However I wouldnt recommend the beach as it isnt really sandy more really small stones, and the centre is full of shops that sell the same thing again and again.I would however recommend the night stalls that go all the way along the street at the front of the hotel these were lovely, and they sold goods that were unigue and had very friendly people running them. (I can recommend the brazillian cocktails)The pool at the hotel was nice, although it was a bit cold. the entertainment staff were nice. Although the bar at the hotel had very slow service, and there were only 2 other tables being used when we were there.Altogether the hotel was clean, friendly and a very nice hotel for a family, I would deffinatley reccomend this hotel for families with children between 4 and 10.the hotel management need to look at all their rooms and make sure they are all up to the same standards. the bad room we had was 512 (just incase the hotel staff are wandering, oh and the phone didnt work in the room, and although i reported it, they never fixed this for the 2 days we were in the room.Hope I havent put any one off this hotel as it is a great hotel, just that we had a few issues. But these never spoiled our trip, and we would recommend visiting this hotel.
Reviews.Author: mjhutchy

Reviews.Content: Great hotel Stayed 18 - 25 AugustHotel was lovely No negative comment about hotel at all staff were great. Food was in abundance with a lot of variety each day. No queues for the restaurant. Animation crew were very good and keep the children entertained Pool was great and there was plenty of sun beds even though school holidays. Bed were 1 euro per bed per dayRoom was clean and decor neutral. two double beds in room Plenty big enough for 2 adults and 2 kids (11  12) Location was away from the main Santa Susana. There is a lovely walk along promanade filled with market stalls, artistis and hair braiders, which if you keep going along the road you get to the busier area of Santa Susana
Reviews.Author: AnyHerts

Reviews.Content: WORTHWHILE VISITING Very enjoyable stay . the hotel keeps to a high standard of cleaniness and the food was very good and caters for all. The entertainment was of a poor qualityexpect for the belly dancers!!!!
Reviews.Author: ddaz

Reviews.Content: Very good hotel Just returned from 1 week at Onabrava and agree with the reviews saying it is a good tourist hotel. Had a double room and got one double bed in the room - I think superior rooms give 2 double beds in the room. We were on the top (5th) floor and I heard no sounds from the hotel when in the room - had view out towards Malgrat and sea. This end of the resort is certainly the better, quieter end compared to busier Malgrat. Caught the train into Barcelona - 鈧? return for 1 hour journey- just watch out you get the right connection back! No complaints about food or cleanliness. Train also stops at resorts along the coast. Only minor complaint is that the pool loungers are very close together - you have to pay for loungers but only 鈧? and includes towel. Also be warned that the beach shelves steeply into the sea which can be quite rough so not ideal with children. Lots of camping sites in this resort.
Reviews.Author: Londonlass55

Reviews.Content: Fantastic Value for money My wife, son and I had a great week in this hotel from 15th June 2008. If your looking for a fab hotel by Spanish Costa's standards this is it! When you walk into the reception the marble flooring is beautiful and the first thing that hits you is how fresh and clean the place is.Rooms are spotless, fresh and we had two lovely double beds. Toilet / bathroom was also spotless, had a nice shower and bath and the worktop and basin where as good as you'd get at a quality hotel back home. Pool area also excellent, jacuzzi, kids pool and standard pool are cleaned daily and there is a pool bar and some nice soft seats in a shaded area.If you have kids with you there is a smallish games room, but you can use the sister hotel Aquamarina 5 mins walk away that has a huge games room down in the basement.Dining, usual Spanish set up, buffet style but with excellent choice. Good choice if your vegan or if you want to try some european dishes. Breakfasts are fantastic, great choice of fruit, cereals and cooked breakfasts. I heard a few comments from folk complaining about the waiting staff and clearing up. It tells you on the Hotel literature that the dining area closes sharply, the hotel operates on a full board basis for guests. So obviously they want to get tidied up and get onto the following service. I don't have a problem with that.I cannot for the life of me understand why people complain about hotels having other foreign nationals in it, it add's to the atmosphere. EURO 2008 was on and the staff erected two large screens for the evening games and the atmosphere was great with all the different nationals. If your looking for a stricly English speaking Hotel you'd be better staying at home.This is a fantastic hotel if you want a rest. The resort is quiet and there is only so much walking and looking in shops or stalls you can do. But its a great base for taking a trip into Barca, or going on a trip to France. Highly recommend!
Reviews.Author: scotsguy40

Reviews.Content: Superb stay at Onabrava Just returned from a week at the Onabrava and thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The hotel staff are extremely helpful and offer a high level of service. Excellent size room on the 4th floor with good size balcony with sea view and exceptionally clean through out. I booked on a half board basis which I would recommend, excellent selection of buffet service although I'm sure if you were there for 2 weeks it would become a bit repetitive. The hotel receives prominent Dutch, Russian and Eastern European tourists to the area. (There is little choice of restaurants in the resort to eat out otherwise. )Good size pool and there was always enough loungers for everyone. The only downside for us was the hotel entertainment, this caters mostly for families. As a couple in our mid 30's, we could have done with abit more variety. A walk along the front with the nightly craft  jewellery stalls was great and if you walk to the 'Disco Ok' end , there was some good musicians playing in other hotels.The resort of Santa Susanna is perfect for those looking for a fairly quiet holiday. It has great train links for the other coastal resorts and of course Barcelona. We spent 2 days in Barcelona and there was still more we wanted to see. Santa Susanna is more purposely built for the tourists, with not much of the authentic spain to see in the main town. The blue trip on the noddy train, 3 Euros each is worthwhile, great views from the top of the hillside in which you will see the some great villas. (takes about and hour)
Reviews.Author: cat32cat

Reviews.Content: Best in Santa Susana but standards are not high If you need to read about the details of this hotel then read the previous review by Mairn138, it is very accurate except she did not mention you must pay for use of indoor pool and leisure club, about 拢7 a day.I have been to Santa Susana about 4 times now over the past 12 years, i have stayed at Florida Park twice and now the Onabravea twice, previously two years ago. This hotel is definitely one full star better than the Florida Park (currently rated number 2 on this site). The only plus point for Florida Park is that it is about 250 yards nearer to the life and tacky shops. Thinking about it, maybe not a plus point since this area has become more and more full of tacky shops.The Onabrava was better 2 years ago, i seem to rememeber the nightly hotel entertainment was ok then for about 4 nights (amazing for this area of Spain), this visit only one night was acceptable, Oh how i wish i had Simon Cowells buzzer to get the rubbish off the stage.The sunbed contraptions all need replacing, poor design and many broken. Also get your towels on the beds before 9.30 am or you will miss out.The restaurant staff seem to be on some proficiency bonus, who can clear the most plates in an evening before the customers have finished!!!The food choice is excellent but after 10 days one realises the quality is not so good. Food is not always hot, breakfast baked beans are always lukewarm and vegetables in the evening are very poor and sometimes inedible, seven nights i ate chips with my main course because the other potato choices were poorly cooked or corrupted by some regurgitated sauce yuk!The smart Germans who used to stay here seemed to have reduced in numbers, the British contigent is also smaller than before, both have been replaced by Eastern Europeans and Russians, several travel companies ferrying them to Santa Susana seem to have started up recently - it does not bode well for the future. Standards are slipping - i saw at least a dozen men in shorts and some in singlets at dinner, most women look dressed more for shopping than dining - this was never the way 2 years ago, guests would have been told to dress properly and refused entry. This is not just an Onabrava problem, I witnessed it at Florida Park this time also.Having said all that, the hotel onabrava rooms are excellent, the place is modern and spotless, the staff polite and friendly.I will not return to this area of Spain again, once it had a naive charm but now it has developed into a weekly cheap coach trippers resort, not my choice but if that is what you want then Santa Susana will welcome you. Two other points,- if you are visiting this area cling onto your wallet/handbag at all times, there is a continuous queue at the police station of visitors reporting thefts, this area had little crime a couple of years ago- when you trip over the uneven pavements and break your wrist or damage your ankle, I am informed by three people i met (all in plaster), the hospital at Callela (2 train stops away) is excellent and makes our NHS look pathetic (not particularly difficult), some consolation for your injuries i guess.Compared to other hotels in this area i should rate it as excellent but it is in UK terms a 3/4 star hotel which looks very good because it is in a poor area.and yes i am a grumpy old git................................
Reviews.Author: i_am_grumpy_old_git

Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel!       Balconies
Reviews.Author: Mairn138

Reviews.Content: Fantastico Lovely hotel, well worth its 4 star rating. Staff very friendly and more than willing to do anything for you.Food was outstanding, something for everyone, even me, the fussy eater.Had no time to try the pool but looked very clean.Room was perfect size, bed comfy and balcony with good views.Easy access to train direct into Barcelona.Carlsberg don't do hotels but if they did, they still wouldn't be as good as the Onabrava. Will definitely be staying here if ever back in the resort.
Reviews.Author: Stu1983

Reviews.Content: a pleasure to stay in my partner an i stayed in this hotel in april for 1 week and we had no complaints at all staff very helpful, resteraunt spotless, hotel rooms spotless, pool area spotless, in good walking distance to centre [which was very quiet though catering for mainly dutch and spainish] but what bars were open they made you feel welcome all the same. across the road from train station so you can travel to barcelona for a day if resort too quiet. trains pretty regular. overall def would return for a break to this hotel.
Reviews.Author: enncle

Reviews.Content: Ole Onabrava Excellent hotel...beautiful pool with area for non-swimmers...i.e. those of us who can't swim but like to paddle around. Spotlesslessly clean everywhere..variety of food with something to suit everyone. Train to Barcelona in front of hotel. Would recommend. One quibble, if you order breakfast in bed, make sure you have the money ready or they won't leave it ! Having said that there is enough breakfast to feed a family, never mind just 2.
Reviews.Author: marnia

Reviews.Content: Aqua Hotel Onabrava Booked for 4 nights Half Board, through Alpharooms, for 拢180 for 2 people.Good all-round high class hotel. Food excellent, good size room, very clean throughout, friendly staff. Little noise from railway.Overall, couldn't fault anything, though were disappointed that the indoor pool was out of action for a couple of days for maintenance. The indoor pool was one of the reasons we chose this hotel.Would recommend the hotel to anyone.
Reviews.Author: briza43

Reviews.Content: really good All the reviews we read at this place were good and, after our stay at the hotel, we can say that they are all true. A 4-star hotel with 4-star facilities, room, and food at a good price. We'll stay there again in our next holiday in Santa Susanna.Any inconvenience? Well, perhaps the only one, if any, was the noise of an air continioning system from a neighbouring hotel.
Reviews.Author: DavidO100

Reviews.Content: top hotel Excellent hotel . Very modern. Spotlessly clean. great buffet. Will definately go again
Reviews.Author: andrew1961

Reviews.Content: Great place to stay to visit Barcelona/Girona Have just returned from this hotel - it was so clean, the staff are friendly. The hotel was very busy for this time of year - lots of Spanish OAP's on vacation. The food and service was excellent - lots of choice and always hot and fresh - lots of fruit, meats, vege options, breads, ices and yogurts. Prices in the bar were not too expensive. Entertainment very good. The hotel is quite noisy with no soft furnishings to absorb the noise. 2 mins from the station with regular fast service into Barcelona. The only downside was the transport from the airport to the hotel and the return. We booked the shuttle which seemed a good deal but we waited well over an hour to be picked up (did the school run first) and then had to be ready for return at 7.20 a.m. and they did not turn up until 8.40 a.m. ( supposed to be at the airport for 9.30 and arrived at 10.25 a.m.!) - I think they had done the morning school run too - but why ask us to be ready so early I really have no idea. Perla Tours - the shuttle service - DO NOT USE THIS.
Reviews.Author: kathpasco

Reviews.Content: aqua onabrava hotel February 2008Although Santa Suzanna is still closed for the winter, because of the Aqua Onabrave Hotel it is still well worth a visit as a base to tour up and down this area of the Costa Brava. The hotel is first class for the money. In fact its first class. Staff, food, rooms, facilities all function well. I imagine this hotel would be a perfect family holiday in the summer. At the moment you walk out of the hotel step straight onto the train and 1 hour later you at at the centre of Barcelona.Tips. Avoid Malgrat at all costs and at all times. Its run down and should be closed down.Calella always worth a day out its a holiday town but with real people.Use the train everywhere along the coast. Just get off and on at all the little coastal towns and see for yourself some are good for tourists some are not. But take a look anyway.
Reviews.Author: martincraven100

Reviews.Content: Great Xmas break Took a 5 day break over Xmas with Festive Getaways.Room very spacious and clean with balcony view over the pool and beach. ( Balcony good as hotel interior is nonn smoking.)Food was excellent. Buffet choice great. Xmas eve dinner and Xmas day lunch was a lovely set menu with wine/cava included.Station just across road and gets to Barcelona for 6.20 Euros in just over an hour - pretty journey tracking along the beaches all the way there. City double decker bus tour 2 day pass 24 euros.To get to Lorette and Tossa you take train to Blanes and jump on bus outdie station. Public transport ran spot on time even on Xmas and Boxing day.The hotel organised a Flamenco Spaish night nearby for 25 euros ( i think) well worth it!Great value
Reviews.Author: MikeSutton

Reviews.Content: star treatment Star treatment quality rooms.Great entertainment team.Beautiful location and facilities.ex food lovely cocktails great value for money.
Reviews.Author: KerryDirector

Reviews.Content: Good base in a developed resort I took the previous reviewer's advice and booked directly, saving 25% on the deals on offer through the booking websites.The good:Modern, spotlessly clean, nice (though basic) rooms, good views over the sea (across railway line, though all properties here tend to suffer from that), friendly staff, across the road from the railway station (1hr to barcelona for around 7 Euros return), free parking, indoor pool (though at extra cost), the choice of breakfast buffet was huge.The bad (Really minor stuff):Satellite TV with only CNN and BBC World Service in English so not entirely entertaining.A modern purpose built resort so no traditional bars or restaurants (frustrating to my personal taste).Hints:Hire a car and go west to the Montseny National park for some stunning mountains - Hike (or drive) up Turo de'l Home for panoramic views including the coast and the pyrenees.Take a healthy (25 minute) walk along the promenade to Malgrat de Mar where you'll find lots of traditional cafes and restaurants.Take the train to Blanes for some nice sea front restaurants - Sunday was great as local families were promenading as we enjoyed lunch overlooking the sea.There is a Carrefour supermarket close by (5 minute drive or 15/20 minute walk) where you can stock up on food and drink (we picniced on our balcony a couple of evenings).
Reviews.Author: Andrew_McQuilly

Reviews.Content: great value if booked direct booked 6 nights b + b for two for 拢40 a night great hotel for something like this nice big roomn two double beds . big bathroom with bidet. really hot and powerful shower. rooms cleaned daily and towels changed daily . mini bar cost us 22 euros to get it for the week with about 15 soft drinks or we could have paid 2 euros a day for it empty - ideal for keeping the cava cool - necessary when you buy it in the hotel owned supermarket at 3.25 rather than in the bar at 16.75!! great balcony we got the sun in the afternoon. ideal for the station and about a 5 minute walk to the centre of santa susanna.downside was the food. we were b and b ( we had been half board in the aqua hotel montagut suites last year and it was excellent value again) There appears to be nowhere in Santa Susanna where you can get genuine spanish food. we went to one rest linked to the Mercury Hotel which wasnt bad but we paid 50 euros for a three course meal for two with a glass of rioja which bizarrely was chilled and we couldnt eat there every night as the choice was limited. With the excpetion of The Ship - a british owned pub but where food was ok everywhere else sold hard baguettes, hot dogs, burgers or pasta and pizza and paella all of which were blitzed in a microwave - athough the chips were good - if you were feeding a small army ! we had to go to barcelona to get a decent meal!if you go - go half board
Reviews.Author: moseywosey

Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel This hotel definitely met with my expectations and that of my family. My wife and I and our 2 children stayed here for 4 nights and the whole experience was generally very favourable. The hotel is clean, modern, spacious with attentive staff and high quality on offer. The rooms are well appointed and the food is of a high level. The swimming pool is the best in the resort as far as we were concerned.I would totally recommend this hotel to families as a safe bet!!One word of caution, if you are a family with small children or like your beauty sleep before midnight make sure you are not allocated rooms 101 to 110 on the first floor as these rooms are directly above the music area and the sound proofing is non existent!However, this is one very small negative in what otherewise is a very classy and high quality hotel.
Reviews.Author: pompey52

Reviews.Content: Very nice!!! This is a very nice hotel. Very clean. Across the street from the beach. It was to cold to use the pool outside. There is a fee to use the indoor pool. The meals are buffet style, but nice.
Reviews.Author: Shecaja

Reviews.Content: Top class all the way!!! One of the best hotels i have stayed in.Cleaner than clean.Food was superb.Loads of choice and always fresh.Pool and lounging area nice size,got to get your lounger early though or youl miss out.couldnt fault the place one bit,was just a pity we had to leave.Had a great time at onabrava,Sure you will..
Reviews.Author: boruc01

Reviews.Content: Had a great time! My wife and I stayed here for a quick 4 day getaway and we had a great time. The rooms were simple but clean and very well-kept. The pool area was always in order. The food was plentiful, varied and quite good. The staff was polite and helpful. The location of the hotel was especially good -- right along the main promenade of Santa Susanna, just a short walk to the train or to the ocean. The train takes you into Barcelona in an hour, so it's a good place to stay if you want to take a day trip (as we did). Santa Susanna is a nice little touristy town, with your standard trinket shops and the obligatory British pub. It's a safe town as well, we had no concerns walking at night. Now, if you're looking for a hotel in the lap of luxury with everything in the hotel of the highest possible quality -- then this isn't the place for you. It's a resort hotel, a place to lay by the pool, do some shopping, eat more than you should and just relax. We found it to be a very nice resort and excellent value for money. We've recommended it to friends and we recommend it to you!
Reviews.Author: Rathskeller

Reviews.Content: 4 Star? They've got to be kidding       Ring of mould
Reviews.Author: allwrite

Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel and a great holiday This hotel was clean and tidy, the restaurant had a good variety of food and always plenty of seating, even in busy times. On the whole, the staff were friendly and polite, and always helpful. However, some of the reception staff did struggle to understand english that well, and are not always the fastest! Saying that, every request we had was dealt with and we were not unhappy.Our room had air conditioning, and was kept very clean. The bathroom was a nice size and always well stocked with towels, toiletries and toilet paper.We stayed here when the Spanish Grand Prix was on (we had already bought our tickets direct from the circuit months before). there was a bus direct from the htoel to the circuit for 25 euros each, on all 3 days. We went to Barcelona 3 times while staying here - the train platform is only just over the road and only costs 6 euros each return to Barcelona and about a one hour trip.
Reviews.Author: chariot

Reviews.Content: Great and then not so great   showReview(5235043, 'full');
Reviews.Author: markbebb

Reviews.Content: Not if you want to relax   showReview(5067901, 'full');
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A great Christmas break   showReview(4326100, 'full');
Reviews.Author: Haberdasher

Reviews.Content: Christmas in Santa Susanna       The pool in December
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Highly Recommended       View of the hotel from the platform of the train station - it really is easy to get to!
Reviews.Author: torko
